intro: Triactina, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, translucent petals that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the family Onagraceae and is known for its unique floral structure, which consists of three pairs of petals. Triactina thrives in cool, moist environments and requires specific soil conditions to flourish. Due to its rarity and ecological sensitivity, it is considered a protected species in its native habitat.
